title: Ireland’s ‘horrendous’ Lansdowne Road defeat to Samoa serves as a warning from history ahead of crucial World Cup clash
text:
It remains Ireland’s only defeat by Samoa. A 40-25 reverse at Lansdowne Road in 1996, in which the rampant Pacific Islanders ran in five tries on a sorry night in a sorry period for Irish rugby.

For Paul Wallace, it is a reminder of what could happen to Ireland today if they fail to pay their opponents enough respect.

“Samoa are an incredibly dangerous team,” the former Ireland prop says. “Ireland should beat them comfortably on Saturday. But then, we thought that back in 1996 as well ...”

Wallace, who played in that game, has managed to forget most of it. Amusingly, he cannot even remember whether he scored. Some websites list P Wallace as Ireland’s sole scorer. Others list his older brother,...
description: It remains Ireland’s only defeat by Samoa.
